The Dawless ebook

Learn to make music without a computer

Are you tired of staring at a screen all day? Be a part of a growing group of musicians who want to spend more time making music than learning software.

Scroll Down

About the Book

I love making music but the last thing I wanted to do at night was look at my computer. I was burned out and my music was suffering. Recently, I ditched Ableton and started using hardware to make music and found myself loving the creative process again.

I wrote this book to answer the question: "What is the right setup for your unique needs?" I want to save you tons of hours of research and dollars purchasing the wrong hardware. I'll cover four major areas:

  1. Identify your goals and give an overview of the hardware options.
  2. Deep dive the different different setups with a list of pro's and con's.
  3. Explain how to hook up and configure your hardware.
  4. High quality resources to learn more once your harware arrives.

Along the way I'll share advice and interviews with some of the best producers who are making music without a computer.

Hardware Guide

I spent over 100 hours researching and trying gear so you don't have to. I'll break down everything you need to build a complete dawless setup. I'll also share common mistakes people make when buying used gear so you don't get ripped off.

Expert Interviews

I spoke with 17 leading musicians embracing dawless setups. Learn from the best and hear how they setup their studio to maximize inspiration and immediate results.

How to hook everything up

Need to know the difference between MIDI cables and patch cables? I've tried tons of different cables and configurations and will share the ideal ways to connect your hardware together so it all works seamlessly.

Other instruments

Effects

What are effects and which ones are important to the sound you want to create.

Sequencers

Mixers

The 'brain'

Headphones, speakers, monitors

Difference between speakers and monitors / What's important in a listening setup.

Connecting everything

Definitions / MIDI vs. USB / Common MIDI setups / Audio connections.

Appendix: Buying gear

New vs. Used / What to watch out for when buying used / Trustworthy review sources

Appendix: Full interview transcripts

Complete interviews with 17 leading dawless artists

Who is this book for?

  • "I spend all day looking at a screen and don't want to look at my computer."
  • "I find the thousands of VST's and software instruments out there overwhelming."
  • "I want to have a more hands on, tactile approach to making music."
  • "I want a simpler setup that I can turn on and let me creative juices flow."
  • "I am intrigued by the recent resurgance of hardware to make electronic music."

If any of the above statements ring true, this book is for you!
